sentences.en: Brawl between many couples is one of the problems in this apartment.
sentences.cn: 许多夫妇的争吵,是这栋公寓的问题之一.
吵闹: 起重机; 令人厌烦的霸天虎.

sentences.en: Did you take part in the brawl yesterday?
sentences.cn: 昨天你参与吵架了 吗 ?
球迷们在体育馆外面闹事。

sentences.en: He got a load on and started a brawl.
sentences.cn: 他喝酒过量开始了怒骂.

sentences.en: He had been in a drunken street brawl.
sentences.cn: 他参与了一场酒后街头斗殴。

sentences.en: He hit her with a frying pan during a drunken brawl.
sentences.cn: 他酒后耍酒疯用平底锅打了她。

sentences.en: He spurned my suggestion that he shouldn't go and see the brawl of the hoodlums.
sentences.cn: 他冷然地拒绝了我提的不要去看阿飞们吵架的建议.

sentences.en: In February 1807, British seamen got into a brawl with local Chinese.
sentences.cn: 1807年2月, 广州发生英国水手与华人殴斗的事件.

sentences.en: John got messed up in the brawl.
Players should no longer experience ethereality issues after a tavern brawl.
sentences.cn: 酒馆乱斗将不会某名奇妙损失玩家的经验.

sentences.en: The brawl in the street could be heard in the house nearby.
sentences.cn: 在附近的房子里都能听到街上的争吵声.

sentences.en: They had nothing better to do than brawl in the street.
sentences.cn: 他们除了在街上斗殴做不出什么好事.

sentences.en: We could hear the loud brawl of a brook behind the house.
sentences.cn: 我们可以听到房子后面小河的哗哗流水声.

sentences.en: What we have gotten here is more a brawl than a debate.
sentences.cn: 这里的样子不像在讨论而像是在吵架.

sentences.en: Whatever brawl disturb the street, there shall be peace at home.
sentences.cn: 街上无论多麽喧闹, 家中应有宁静.

trans.tran_cn: 吵架，打架，喧闹的舞会，乱哄哄的拳赛

trans.tran_en: to quarrel or fight in a noisy way, especially in a public place

trans.tran_cn: 打架，争吵，互骂，（流水）哗哗地响
